Text: It doesn't make any sense to rip at 320 kbps. Because the difference is not audible anymore if a rip is properly done at 128 kbps. Anything else higher than 128 kpbs is not audible for human ears.

sure pupyup, why trying to have quality ? personaly i prefer flac format but ... a yes human ears can't feel the differences .

:) peace and thanks for the contents.

puppyup, You are seriously mistaken. An acc rip at 128 is comparable to an mp3 at 192. An mp3 rip at 128 sounds like complete shit. If you do a lossy rip to mp3 you might as well do a high VBR in the 250's or just do a constant at 320kpbs.
What deim0n said, exactly. The difference between 128 and anything over 200 is very significant. After that, not so much. I avoid any mp3s that are not at least 192.
One of the best metal songs ever - "When the children cry". Thanx Zibbik!
